arm_group.description: Erlotinib 150mg daily oral up to 2 years

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is to compare 2-year Disease Free Survival Rate (DFSR) in post radical operation
      IIIA Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) patients with Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor
      (EGFR) 19 or 21 exon mutation treated Erlotinib vs NP chemotherapy as adjuvant therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Erlotinib in Post Radical Operation NSCLC Patients With EGFR Mutation
clinical_study.condition: Non-small Cell Lung Cancer Stage III

facility.name: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital
The second people's hospital of Sichuan
The third affiliated hospital of Harbin Medical Univer
The affiliated hospital of medical college Qingdao University
The first affiliated hospital of Soochow University
The fourth military medical university，Tangdu Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Open-labelled, Randomized, Multicenter Phase II Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Erlotinib vs NP Chemotherapy as Adjuvant Therapy in Post Radical Operation NSCLC Patients With EGFR19 or 21 Exon Mutation

overall_official.affiliation: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

primary_outcome.description: 2-year disease free survival rate is defined as the estimation percentage of disease free survival patients with study treatment at 2-year.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Disease free survival is defined as the time from randomization to disease recurrence or death which comes first.
Overall survival is defined as the time from randomization to death.
The score of Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Lung (FACT-L) subscale and Lung Cancer Symptom Scale (LCSS)

clinical_study.source: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
